Position highlights ICBC is one of BC's largest corporations and one of Canada's largest property and casualty (P&C) insurers with annual earned premiums of $5 billion and $22 billion in assets. ICBC's actuaries primarily work in two areas: Insurance Pricing and Corporate Actuarial. We currently have opportunities for a student to join our Pricing or Corporate team as an Actuarial Assistant. In the Pricing team, you will apply your technical skills in Actuarial Science to support various functions including rate indications for Basic and Optional Insurance products, rate design, program evaluation, actuarial review and insurance modeling projects. In the Corporate team, your work will support functions such as reserving, financial reporting, capital adequacy testing, claims data preparation, forecasting claims trends, reconciliation and validation. Other duties may also be assigned depending on the successful candidate's training and experience. Perks and Benefits As a valued member of the ICBC team, you'll thrive in a performance-driven • environment that emphasizes employee leadership and accountability for delivering results. • You will work twice a week at our North Vancouver Head Office, next to the seabus and Lonsdale Quay, which provides easy access to the beautiful scenary, mountains and hiking trails of the North Shore • You will be able to work from home up to 3 days a week if you choose to, with the flexibility of a schedule that works for you. • Excellent compensation package. • People oriented work environment with ongoing campaigns that address physical, social, financial and mental health. • Free access to the fully-equipped ICBC gym and fitness classes. • Your work will involve the largest vehicle dataset in the province and have the potential to impact auto insurance for all drivers in BC.
